org.micromanager.metadata
Class AcquisitionData

java.lang.Object
  org.micromanager.metadata.AcquisitionData

public class AcquisitionData
extends java.lang.Object

Encapsulation of the acquisition data files. Enables the user access pixels and and other data through a simple interface.

AcquisitionData

public AcquisitionData()
Constructs an empty object. load() or createNew() must be called before use.

Method Detail

load

public void load(java.lang.String basePath)
          throws org.micromanager.metadata.MMAcqDataException
Loads the metadata from the acquisition files stored on disk and initializes the object. This method must be called prior to any other calls.

Parameters:
basePath - - acquisition directory path
Throws:
org.micromanager.metadata.MMAcqDataException

load

public void load(org.json.JSONObject metadata)
          throws org.micromanager.metadata.MMAcqDataException
Loads contents from the JSON object. This method should be used only within Micro-manager for efficiency purposes, i.e. to avoid conversions between string and object representations of metadata.

Parameters:
metadata - JSON object
Throws:
org.micromanager.metadata.MMAcqDataException

createCopy

public AcquisitionData createCopy()
                           throws org.micromanager.metadata.MMAcqDataException
Creates a copy of the entire data set with exact replica of the metadata. However, files are not copied at the second location. Instead, file references are removed from the original instance, and retained in the new one. TODO: it is not clear why is this method required and how is it intended to be used Consider removing

Returns:
- new instance
Throws:
org.micromanager.metadata.MMAcqDataException

createNew

public void createNew(java.lang.String name,
                      java.lang.String path,
                      boolean autoName)
               throws org.micromanager.metadata.MMAcqDataException
Creates the new acquisition data set. If the object was already pointing to another data set, it will be simply disconnected from it - no data will be lost. The actual name of the directory for the data set will be created using "name" variable as the prefix and the acquisition number as the suffix. Acquisition numbers are automatically generated: e.g. "name_0", "name_1", etc.

Parameters:
name - - acquisition name (title)
path - - root directory for the acquisition
Throws:
org.micromanager.metadata.MMAcqDataException

createNew

public void createNew()
               throws org.micromanager.metadata.MMAcqDataException
Creates a new in-memory acquisition data set. If the object was already pointing to another data set, it will be simply disconnected from it - no data will be lost.

Throws:
org.micromanager.metadata.MMAcqDataException

getPixels

public java.lang.Object getPixels(int frame,
                                  int channel,
                                  int slice)
                           throws org.micromanager.metadata.MMAcqDataException
Returns pixel array for the entire image specified by coordinates: frame, channel, slice. Pixels are packed by lines. The type of the array depends on the pixel depth (getPixelDepth()), e.g. byte[] (depth 1), or short[] (depth 2). Size of the array is width * height (getImageWidth() and getImageHeight()) If the frame is missing, this method returns null.

Parameters:
frame -
channel -
slice -
Returns:
- pixel array
Throws:
org.micromanager.metadata.MMAcqDataException

                                    int frame,

                             throws org.micromanager.metadata.MMAcqDataException

                                int slice)
                         throws org.micromanager.metadata.MMAcqDataException
Inserts a single image metadata into the acquisition data set. This method is used to generate metadata without recording pixel data in any way.

Parameters:
frame - - frame (time sample)index
channel - - channel index
slice - - slice (focus) index
Throws:
org.micromanager.metadata.MMAcqDataException

saveImageFile

public static boolean saveImageFile(java.lang.String fname,
                                    java.lang.Object img,
                                    int width,
                                    int height)
Utility to save TIF files. No connection to the metadata.

Parameters:
fname - - file path
img - - pixels
width -
height -
Returns:
- true if successful
